revised_title: The Absence of Sugar in the Blood of Diabetes Patients
tldr: Dr. Wollaston conducted experiments to determine if sugar found in the urine of diabetes patients also exists in their blood. He used prussiate of potash as a test substance and found no detectable amount of it in the blood of these patients. This led him to believe that there might be an unknown pathway for substances to pass from the stomach to the bladder without going through the blood.
